     i accidentally stumbled upon a great technique for staying original, which is don't pay too much attention to anyone else. so all i have to do is just try to do things however i think is reasonable. and pow, people think it's unique. what is everyone else doing that is so different from me? perhaps i will never know

     i am not

     i have a feeling you are being forced to ask me questions. are you ok?

10.31.17  1:33 pm   how to make a unique question to ask you because i want to suprise you like every other people 

     if i help you come up with the question then i don't think it's going to surprise me

10.31.17  10:30 am   If I really want to start a conversation, and message someone a paragraph, and all they reply with is a 3-worded answer, can I do anything besides be sad?

     perhaps it can be a learning experience. it might not always be a good idea to start a conversation with a huge lengthy message. perhaps save that for when you know the person a little better

10.31.17  9:59 am   10.30.17  8:22 pm I didn't ask the question but I think I would have been sleeping at what point. Why were you improvising instead?

     i guess my question to you is, at 9:59 am today you were asking me this question. why weren't you sleeping instead?

10.31.17  9:17 am   What obstacles will you face before touring with a band under your direction?

     first i'm gonna come out with a lot more music. not a challenge really, but it does take time. especially considering they all have to have videos.
i'm trying to move as quickly as possible here

10.31.17  9:17 am   has this questions page convinced you that we are all stupid

     on a scale of yes to no, i'd say my favourite colour is spaghetti. owo.

10.31.17  8:37 am   What is your favourite passtime that isn't making videos

     wishing i could figure out how to make more videos faster but still do them as good as i want

10.31.17  7:34 am   i'm confused how can you reply to all 3 of my previous questions but not to the most important one: why won't you reply to my dm, it has a very important question

     because i answered someone else's dm instead

10.31.17  6:43 am   Will you do an anagram in the wrong section? (this one)

      i used to do them here, before there was an anagrams page. i used to respond to any question asking about anagrams by anagramming the question instead of answering it. this unfortunately lead down a rabbit hole of people asking for longer and longer anagrams. this was thrilling for me, but the really long ones were actually taking me all day. and with the format of this page, i can't save them for later, because i always answer questions in chronological order. so basically it would stall the questions page (or else i would have to skip it, which i didn't want to do). this is really what made me realize i need to build the anagrams page, and take requests, and i can take them out of order and just work on them whenever i get a chance

10.31.17  6:23 am   Why can't we wash our eyes?

     i think you can

10.31.17  5:13 am   So is your last note written in 2016 and you are updating the notebook page with previously written notes?

     well, it really depends what counts. which has been an ongoing blurred line for quite some time. particularly after i started writing for twitter regularly in 2014. nowadays each update for "new" content to the notebook page actually consists of mostly combing through all my tweets and picking out which ones seem to be more central to me, and weeding out the ones that seem to just be composed to fill space on twitter. then uploading them and tracking down the dates, preferably when it was written, not when it was tweeted (there is often a several day difference.) and ALSO a new notes update entails going through my files and finding other things that i have written which might work well exclusively for the notes page. but there are less and less of those, over time, because while i used to use text as both an outlet for journaling and creativity, nowadays my primary outlet for journaling is audio recordings, and my primary outlet for creativity is audio/visual content. so what's happening is, in terms of newly written content for the notebook page, the vast majority of it will be things that have already been released on twitter. so in other words, when i do the next big "new" notebook update, it's going to be 95% tweets that you would have already seen if you follow my twitter page. and if you follow my twitter page you will see a new tweet every day. in addition i am constantly filling in more and more content from the past (much longer stuff, not tweets). people constantly ask my "why i don't use the notebook page anymore" but i continue to use it for the same purpose i have always used it, and furthermore if you want to see the new content, it's on twitter, every day. i hope that makes sense

     try focusing on why you need it. that should give you ideas
